conversation.content:
[gasp] The White House just called. The actual White House. [pause] They want—they want my 1982 Bordeaux for the state dinner with the French President. [very excited] I can't stop shaking, like, my hands won't—[laugh] thirty-seven years I've been saving that vintage. Thirty-seven! [long pause] Dad would've been so proud. He always said, [emotional], "Sophie, that wine will know when it's time." [sniffle] I thought he was being, um, poetic or whatever but—[extremely happy] THE PRESIDENTIAL DINNER! 

[whispering] I keep saying it out loud to make it real. [clearing throat] They said the sommelier specifically requested it after reading that article about our family vineyard. [proudly] Four generations of winemakers and now—[gasp softly] oh God, what if something happens during transport? [anxious] What if the temperature fluctuates or—no, no, stop it Sophie. [confidently] This is our moment. 

[warm] Mom used to say our grapes grew different because we sang to them. [chuckle] I thought she was crazy but, I mean, here we are. [very sincerely] A wine we bottled with our own hands is going to be poured at the White House. [pause] I need to call everyone. [delighted] I need to call EVERYONE!
